page.title: 02ATTITUDES
page.content: We wanted to find out in 1985 what the people in Dumfries thought was the most important local issue. The results are as follows: {RENT & RATES 32% {TRAFFIC SYSTEM 12% {DIRTY STREETS} {8% {NO COMMENT 12% {NOTHING FOR TEENAGERS 4% {BYPASS 20% {PEDESTRIANISATION 4% {ROADS 8% Local government is funded primarily from the rates levied on property. There was a rates revaluation which meant that combined with the cut in the Rates Support Grant,the rates had to be increased substantially. After the revaluation it meant that the rate in the pound was increased to 47.3p,an increase of 25% for domestic ratepayers.
